feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission demonstrates a working financial application: it accepts capital‑budgeting inputs, computes and displays cash flows/analysis, and compares projects (IMPLEMENT evidence). The student also shows conceptual understanding and reflection on limitations, adding features (pros/cons) to improve financial decision quality (DISCOVER and REFLECT), meeting the standards for PASS.
- Integrate AI: The submission shows a working AI integration that computes and analyzes capital‑budget metrics and provides narrative "deep dive" analyses, and the student extended the tool (comparison dashboard, pros/cons) to improve AI outputs. This demonstrates effective, value‑adding AI integration at a level appropriate for the assignment.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "I want to create an app that can take inputs for capital budgeting and solve them with ease."
"So this is my final and so the first thing my first thought was with things like uh investing we want to be able to compare two different projects. So I had to add a comparison dashboard."
"the AI will take into account those pros and cons to kind of counteract the idea that the AI doesn't really know much about the project."
criteria.driver_alignment: DISCOVER — student identified the need for a capital‑budgeting tool and set the app goal; IMPLEMENT — student built a final app with input fields, sliders, cash‑flow timelines and a comparison dashboard; REFLECT — student critiqued AI limits and added pros/cons to improve real‑world decision relevance.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates a working financial application: it accepts capital‑budgeting inputs, computes and displays cash flows/analysis, and compares projects (IMPLEMENT evidence). The student also shows conceptual understanding and reflection on limitations, adding features (pros/cons) to improve financial decision quality (DISCOVER and REFLECT), meeting the standards for PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "The prompt I gave the AI is I'm a financial accounting student who hates calculating the necessary factors of capital budgeting. I want to create an app that can take inputs for capital budgeting and solve them with ease. I want this app to be simple but effective so a nontechnical audience with little to no accounting experience can understand it."
"but it does it calculates and analyze our data. It gives us an AFI finish analyst that's great"
"We can see it gives us a deep dive analysis. talks about the net's value, talks about the pros and cons."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover — student framed the problem and crafted an AI prompt to automate capital budgeting calculations; Implement — integrated the AI analysis into the app and added UI/features (comparison dashboard, sliders); Reflect — recognized AI limitations and added pros/cons inputs so the AI analysis accounts for non‑numeric factors.
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows a working AI integration that computes and analyzes capital‑budget metrics and provides narrative "deep dive" analyses, and the student extended the tool (comparison dashboard, pros/cons) to improve AI outputs. This demonstrates effective, value‑adding AI integration at a level appropriate for the assignment.
